lines.text: There's thirteen people in the audience.
This is no time to be superstitious. It's bad luck.
"Food By Anton". There's a nice bit. Here we are loaded with talent, and some hash hustler gets his name up in lights.

[after Candy breaks a mirror]
Hey, what's the matter with you? That's seven years bad luck.
Let's make it fourteen.
[smashes another mirror]
Wanna try for twenty-one?
[Candy smashes a third mirror]
Boy, ain't this party a ball?
What's with the ain'ts? Ain'ts. There are a lot of ritzy people here. Watch your language.
What are you talking about? I speak as well as anybody. In fact, weller.

[after Flo pushes Lorraine into the swimming pool]
How did it go?
Swimmingly.
Alright, Lorraine. Now that I've heard the words let me hear the music.
If that scullery maid dares come near my father, I'll annihilate her!

[sings]
It isn't that I'm superstitious, superstitious, I am not. / Nevertheless I take no chances walking under ladders.

[sings]
There's thirteen reasons why I feel this way.

[sings]
Never tap your toe in June, to an organ grinder's tune. / Men who pick up rusty pins marry girls with double chins.
Hap, stop it!
What's the matter?
Well, you know that whistling in the dressing room is bad luck.
Isn't that cute? Two months in show business, she knows all the rules.
Well, you're the one that told me.
But a trouper never says die!

Be alert, my child. You are passing through a period of opportunity. You are on the brink of adventure. A mysterious stranger lurks in your future. A stranger who may serve as a guide to your fortune and destiny.
A mysterious stranger.

[sings]
I speak to the stars, and I wait for an answer.

[sings]
And the Bluebells of Broadway are ringing...

[sings]
The Bluebells are ringing with a bag-pipe beat on Broadway, on Broadway tonight.
This is strictly business, Mr. Carson.
Yes, Miss Williams. Strictly business.
Oh, Mr. Carson!
[hugs him]

[sings]
Love you dearly, more than just sincerely.

[sings]
That's why I wanna sing like an angel, and dance, dance, like the devil. So Mr. Leader-man, strike up the band, and let's go! Let's go, let's go, let's go, let's go¸ let's go!
It must be an exciting life being a lady.
You should try it sometime. Er, er... marry a Lord, that is.
Say, how about a little square-dancin'? Yahoo!
[jumps on the table and it collapses]
Alright?
Must be these boots, I'm used to dancing in my bare feet. How's everybody? Ah! Yahoo!
[last lines]
Ooh, Friday the Thirteenth. Anyone around here superstitious?
Well, I, I... I used to be. But I'm not anymore. Not Lucky Me.
[first lines]

[sings]
Lucky me! / Down the four leaf clover highway, all the signs are pointing my way. / Yes siree. / For lucky me, lucky me, yes siree. / With a lucky star to guide me, and the one I love beside me. / Life can be, so fancy free! / Don't you wish that you could be... Lucky Me!
